summary:
Chris has vast experience in design, development and deployment of Content, Process and Case Management solutions. Deep technical experience in complex and distributed solutions in large financial services and Petroleum organizations locally and abroad. He has developed content and process components in successfully deployed work and case management solutions. He understands the full (SDLC) Software development lifecycle to deliver meaningful capabilities and solutions. Chris provides technical leadership in the development of these specialized capabilities across multiple ECM vendor products. 
Chris is a professional hard-working individual that always goes the extra mile for his clients and team members. He believes attitude equals altitude and tackles his working career head on. He has done outstanding work in the past leaving no stone unturned and enjoys rising to challenges in his work life as well as his personal. He is an extremely committed individual with lots of curiosity and passion.

awards.title: Innovation Den Winner
awards.description: Ovations ran a competition for Innovation ideas, called the Innovation Den. I was awarded first place in the competition for an e-Receipt idea using NFC. I received a trip to Mauritius.

awards.title: Einstein Achiever for the year award (Top 3)
awards.description: Throughout the year I was recognized for over exceeding company, peer and client expectations. The Einstein Achiever awards are given to the top 3 people within Ovations who had demonstrated the highest level of Excellence, Masterful, Contribution within the company for the year.

awards.title: Einstein award for Contribution and Commitment
awards.description: This award was granted for designing, building and deployment of an EMC Email Contact Centre solution within a very tight time frame. My work was recognized by the client.

awards.title: Einstein award for Commitment
awards.description: I was awarded an Einstein for my commitment, long hours and determination to deliver an integration adapter between Ovaflo and EMC's XCP 2.0 workflow engine which was apart of the EMC's Early Adopters Program.

awards.title: Customer Hero Award
awards.description: This award was awarded to me because of my commitment the De Beers customer. A letter of satisfaction was written by the customer.

awards.title: Gold award for excellent team contribution at De Beers
awards.description: This award was awarded for Excellent team contribution.

projects.title: Nedbank - Transactional Scanning
projects.description: Nedbank invested in a proof of technology called Transactional Scanning solution which was to allow branch users to scan, index and classify content directly into FileNet's repository. This solution's business value came from face validation service that verified ID type documents and reported a percentage of accuracy to the front end at scan time. We embedded this application within IBM Content Navigator. The users of this solution Enterprise Wide Client Onboarding, AML remediation team and Corporate investment banking and the userbase is increasing.

contributors.headline: Solution Architect at Rabobank
Design Thinking | Everything Digital | Product Management | Solver of customer problems

projects.title: Nedbank - FileNet AML
projects.description:
Nedbank Bank Group Technology launched an Evolution Program, to re-design their entire ECM compliment and capability. The technology of choice is IBM FileNet and due to my vast experience in the technology I moved into the team to assist in the design and implementation of the foundation and subsequent solutions. 

The first solution on the Foundation was called Anti Money Laundry (AML) and with the help of IBM’s top worldwide FileNet architecture resources and product owners. The first project was implemented successfully within 4 months to meet SARB requirements. I assisted with the design of the overall solution and due to my passion of development I requested to take the role of the IBM Content Navigator UI Development Lead, responsible for designing all ICN UI related activities as well as coach and lead the ICN technical team, one in China and one locally. I additionally taught 3 resources how to develop against FileNet in this timeframe. I continue to assist in the overall FileNet solution designs where the needs arise where deep complex scenarios are involved.

contributors.headline: Solution Architect at Rabobank
Principal Consultant and CEO at Arroyo Seco International LLC -- Strategy-driven business solutions leveraging data as an asset
Senior Consultant at Novadoc
All things digital
ECM/IT Program Manager, open to work
Chief Software Architect at IBM
Distinguished Engineer, UI Architect, Broadcom Software

projects.title: Nedbank - ECM Tactical Solutions
projects.description:
I was requested to assist Nedbank Group Technology ECM practice with investigating and resolving major instability issues in their ECM products. 

My role was that of an ECM technical specialist and two main components I drove to stability and took leadership on was that of Opentext IDM (Java Web Service Interface) and an in house developed viewer called Enterprise Imaging Viewer (built on .Net C#).

Due to the huge dependency Nedbank businesses had on these two products deployments were of high profile and high impact. I supported and designed solutions with the three respective technical teams (IDM, EIV and SOA teams) and gave guidance where needed as well as managed stakeholders. The results of all production changes, and testing were successful with successful implementations. The changes implemented created huge performance improvements and stability as well as gained respect and trust from DTO’s, Business, Executives and other senior technical specialists within Nedbank.

Technical Specialist [Enterprise Content Management] | Taxonomist | ECM COE Member

projects.title: First National Bank (FNB) - Email Contact Center
projects.description: Ovations ECM practice engaged and assisted EMC Professional Services to design, develop and implement a Case Management solution for Email Correspondence between FnB their clients, called Contact Case Management. This solution was built on xCP2 and D7 technology. My duties were that of a Java developer to design and implement mid-tier web services on xCP2 using the Document Foundation Services API. These services extended xCP2 Case Management capabilities to custom fit FnB’s developed in-house and product house applications. I successfully implemented and completed phase 1 and phase 2 requirements of the Contact Case Management Solution as a sub-contractor to EMC.

contributors.headline: Solution Architect at Rabobank
Solution Architect at opentext

projects.title: Ovations - Ovaflo xCP2 Adaptor
projects.description: My responsibilities on this project was for developing the Ovaflo EMC Business Process Management Adapter (Ovation's developed case management product) on xCP version 2.0. This was part of the Early Adopters Program and the RSP program run by EMC. I worked extensively on Java DFC, DFS, DQL and developed Custom DFS Web Services to accommodate Ovaflo Requirements

contributors.headline: Solution Architect at Rabobank
Snr. Software Development Engineer, EC2 Core Platform

projects.title: British Petroleum (BP) in Iraq - Finance Invoicing Processing
projects.description:
My first engagement on the BP Iraq Project was that of a Business Analyst in the context of a FileNet Specialist for the first phase. The first phase of the project was to assess two major Business Units located at the IRAQ Oil plants, namely; Engineering Document Controls and Finance Invoice Processing. 

The second phase of the project was to build the FileNet infrastructure to be deployed in Iraq and Implement the Invoice processing solution. 
My duties then changed to that of a Technical Lead and Solution Designer where I designed and lead the team responsible for delivering the application portion of the solution. I lead a team of 4 technical FileNet Specialists and developers located in Dubai, South Africa and Egypt. I assisted the Overall Solution Architect and Infrastructure Leads.

contributors.headline: Solution Architect at Rabobank
Reimagining human connections through the virtual world

projects.title: Clicks Direct Medicines - IBM Transition Project
projects.description: Due to my development and technical skill I assisted and supported the Clicks Transition project to move their Application Support over to IBM locally, India and Egypt. I took handover of all Business Applications from senior personnel that chose to leave Clicks and transfer all gained knowledge to resources in India and Egypt IBM Teams. I also assisted in the Production development support of the environments and the integration projects into the Discovery Scheme, which ran at the time.

projects.title: ABSA Bank - Sorrento Pension Fund
projects.description:
On the Sorento project at ABSA we delivered a Business Process framework solution using IBM FileNet BPF application set. My roles on the project was a FileNet SME and Solution Architect with the following duties:
•	Engage with IBM's Support, BPF and SWAT Team across UK, USA, China, Dublin
•	Engage with ABSA and IBM Architects
•	Provider technical support and guidance to IBM's Project team
•	Design solutions according to Business requirements. 
•	Conducted Technical Specification Reviews for IBM FileNet project Team. 
•	Assist\Support with migrations into UAT, SIT, MAINT and Production environments.
•	Respond to FileNet Penetration Testing and lock down of FileNet.
One of my main achievements on this project was when I improved, with the help of DB2 team in the UK, the migration process from 8 hours to 10 minutes. I was requested by the BPF China development team if this could be added to the BPF Performance Tuning Guide.

projects.title: CIB Standard Bank - Content Cafe
projects.description:
Early in 2007 I was assigned to the Content Cafe project at CIB Standard Bank to implement an ECM solution country wide that would grow worldwide. 
My duties on the project team was to assist the project as a FileNet SME. 
•	I assisted Solution Architecture with HA\DR infrastructure and application designs
•	Standard Bank Security teams with the FileNet Security set
•	Developers with product capabilities and API documentation 
•	BA's with UI capabilities and functionality
I was responsible for implementation of FileNet for all environments (DEV,QA,Production,HA,DR) as well as configuration and support of the FileNet Solution.

projects.title: Zurich (SA Eagle Insurance) - Fish Eagle
projects.description:
My first FileNet Project was the SA Eagle (Zurich) Fish Eagle Project to role out FileNet\Ovaflo Case Management solution nationally to replace an existing FileNet Acenza system. This FileNet deployment was considered the largest FileNet deployment in South Africa at the time.
My duties were:
•	Production Installation of FileNet in Johannesburg, Durban, Cape Town 
•	Installation of DEV, UAT, Training and DR.
•	Supporting and Administration, 
•	Upgrading of FileNet during the project, 
•	Designing and implementing the DR FileNet application, 
•	Escalating calls with FileNet International teams, 
•	Supporting developers and project team with FileNet related work

courses.name: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management Server

profile_positions.description:
I joined the Nedbank Enterprise Architecture team with the focus of the ECM Domain, delivering capabilities for the Nedbank Group - referred to as the ECM Foundation Program. My duties span across the organization’s ECM domain ensuring Governance, Patterns and Capabilities are delivered and adhered to giving business agility to meet customer demands, and meets financial services regulatory and compliance requirements and to support the enterprise’s digital transformation journey. My duties included and not limited to:

•	Alignment of the ECM portfolio with the organizational strategy
•	Key Stakeholder management – cross EA Domains, COE, Executives, Project Office, Solution Architects, Technical Designers
•	Define Architectural Patterns for the Enterprise for all major ECM capabilities for business use-cases
•	Industrialization and commercialization of ECM capability offerings to the organization
•	Technology review and positioning within the Enterprise, scoping from inception to delivery into Production
•	Alignment with ECM Industry innovation, cloud offerings and vendor roadmaps
•	Review and participate in Solution Architecture Forums and Design Forums
•	Engage and understand business needs in alignment with the enterprise digital strategy
•	Influence the adoption of ECM best practices and target states to project Solution Architects,
•	Define ECM roadmaps and transition states to meet target architecture
•	Ensuring all Architectural Assets are at a high standard, accessible, interpretable and usable across multiple stakeholders
•	Encourage and support rationalization, standardization and simplification of ECM technologies across the Enterprise
•	Consult to Business Clusters on ECM capabilities and technologies
profile_positions.title: ECM Domain Architect

profile_positions.description: I was promoted from a senior developer to a Software Architect responsible for technical design patterns, solution building and guidance to a team of IBM Content Navigator and FileNet developers, utilizing ECM best practices and industry standards.
profile_positions.title: Software Architect

profile_positions.description:
I rejoined Ovations as a Senior Developer to skill up, unpack and develop EMC Documentum and xCP2 environments for their clients. A few months later Ovations improved it's operating model to have distinctive practices where I then moved into the ECM Application Developer role to be responsible for all ECM related development on .Net C# and Java technologies.

The strategic choice of ECM solutions at the time was EMC Documentum and IBM FileNet, where I further improved my skill, client experience and certifications.

Although my focus is development I continue to assist in solution building on ECM technologies and assist, develop and share my ECM related experienced with projects, team members and direct reports. Please review my projects attached to this role.
profile_positions.title: Senior Developer

profile_positions.description:
I was appointed at IBM in the Global Business Services division as a senior BPM & ECM consultant to assist in providing solutions for IBM's current and new clients. Soon after my joining I engaged at one of South Africa's largest banks, ABSA, to assist the IBM FileNet project team. 

The second FileNet project I assisted on was the BP Iraq Project delivering an Accounts Payable solution.

Between FileNet projects I assisted on an IBM led project to transition Clicks Direct Medicine over to IBM's technology and application support.
profile_positions.title: FileNet Solution Architect

profile_positions.description:
I moved from a FileNet Support Specialist role into a development role to learn how to develop against the FileNet application stack and to share my FileNet related expierence with Ovaflo Product Development team. Although I was still heavily consulted by the FileNet Support and projects teams my responsibilities as a .Net C# developer consisted of the following:
•	Developing new Features in Ovaflo
•	Deliver assigned tasks\bugs per iteration of Ovaflo.
•	Developed FileNet adapters between Ovaflo and FileNet Process Engine and Content Engine.
•	Bug fixing issues within Ovaflo
•	Supporting and maintaining the FileNet environment for the Ovaflo Development team.
•	Designing Workflows and Taxonomy that will be used by Ovaflo in Demo's for Clients.
•	Performance testing FileNet adapters
•	Unit Test Ovaflo components.

During this time I became certified as a Microsoft Certified Application Developer (MCAD) on .Net C#
profile_positions.title: FileNet Developer (.Net C#)

profile_positions.description:
I was initially hired to be a FileNet Support Engineer at one of Ovations client's, Zurich, to support and implement the new FileNet P8 v 3.0. 
My role grew to supporting the rest of Ovation's FileNet\Ovaflo clients namely; Mutual and Federal, SA Outsourcing, TFD and CIC. I later become a resource on a CIB Standard Bank project as a FileNet Subject Mater Expert assisting with FileNet related work. 
During my time at Ovations I have had exposure to many FileNet components in conclusion my duties at Ovations are listed below.
•	Support FileNet customers at 2\3rd Level.
•	Installation, implementation, troubleshooting, administration support.
•	Migrations of code, FileNet components between environments 
•	Environment Performance optimization
•	FileNet Upgrades.
•	Support Project Teams, Solution Architects and Developers within the FileNet application space.
•	Support Ovaflo (Ovations in house Case Management Solution)
•	Support SQL database environments
•	Taxonomy\ Repository \ Security \ Infrastructure Designs for FileNet
•	Advise on FileNet best practices
profile_positions.title: FileNet Specialist

company.name: The De Beers Group of Companies

profile_positions.description: I was based on-site at De Beers (CHQ). My role was that of a Back Office Support Engineer and worked in a team of three engineers supporting +- 70 servers. I have been in this role from 5th of January 2004. As a team we support both the hardware and software side of a Microsoft 2000 environment with roughly 1100 client users. My line of responsibility ranged from File & Print Servers to SQL and various application servers along side Backups/Restores through various versions of Backup Exec.
profile_positions.title: Server Administrator (Contract via Bytes Technology Group)

profile_positions.description:
I worked as a Desktop Technician for 18 months where I gained a lot of experience supporting +-500 users, until the two branches merged together ( +-1100 users). Before moving into the Desktop level I worked at the Helpdesk where I grew to learn and understand the De Beers culture and understand each department's IT requirement.

In this time I have received two corporate awards from De Beers for Service Performance and always going the Extra Mile. I have in turn received an award from Bytes Technology Network called the Ant Award for teamwork.
profile_positions.title: Desktop Support Technician (Contract via Bytes Technology Group)

profile_positions.description: Duties Before moving to De Beers I worked at Bytes Technology Networks as a Call Center Agent in the ISP department. I gained experience in the Virtual world of Internet along with Pop servers, html, domain registration, dial-ups and mail. I supported all of this as a first line support Agent. I gained much experience in customer interaction and translating technical information to home computer users. I was promoted 6 months later to the Service Delivery Department within Bytes Technology Networks. This is when I moved to De Beers
profile_positions.title: Call Centre Agent

profile_positions.description: I started out with Nixam Computer Store in 2000 as a Sales consultant selling PC systems and software. I completed the ITT course at C.T.I. which was attended after hours. During this time with Nixam I was exposed and liased with clients on a one to one bases and understand important keys of communication with clients. I moved on to Bytes Technology Network as a Call Center Agent for more technical growth Reason for leaving Growth.
profile_positions.title: Sales Consultant
